intro: Lamprospermum guianense, commonly known as the Guianese moonseed, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated berries. Its botanical features include the presence of calcium oxalate crystals in its tissues, which are common in the Menispermaceae family. Lamprospermum guianense is often found in tropical rainforests, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
